phases.name: Phase 0 — Queue Telemetry & Lease Hardening
phases.summary: Make leases, TTLs, dedup windows, and Doctor telemetry actionable so casts never linger unnoticed.

tasks.summary: Audit SqliteQueue leases, dedupe, and Doctor instrumentation.
tasks.description: Review queue/doctor sources, codify TTL/lease recovery rules, and add WAL audit points so lease histories stay observable.

tasks.summary: Add a lease reclamation watchdog tied to WAL logs.
tasks.description: Implement or document a watcher that scans change_queue for expired leases, reclaims them, and logs the events as ChangeQueueLog entries for easier triaging.

phases.name: Phase 1 — Cast Schema & Validation
phases.summary: Ensure every cast payload carries structured headers, approvals, and guard outputs before the queue touches it.

tasks.summary: Define the CastPayload schema and propagate it through models/requests.
tasks.description: Add a typed CastPayload (task_id, agent_id, approvals, TTL, telemetry anchors, guard command outputs) in models.rs and ensure request types/serializers reflect it.

tasks.summary: Enforce payload version/TTL/checksum during validation/enqueue.
tasks.description: Extend validator.rs (or doctor.rs) to assert payload version, TTL, and checksum, then call those checks inside SqliteQueue::enqueue so only audited payloads enter the queue.

phases.name: Phase 2 — Issue → Merge Cast Flow
phases.summary: Ingest Farcaster-style casts, track guard outputs, and buffer them in a merge queue that waits for approvals + CI.

tasks.summary: Build the issue bridge that enqueues casts with guard metadata.
tasks.description: Wire orchestrator.rs/runner.rs to process Farcaster-style casts, record guard commands/approvals, and enqueue them while preserving the metadata.

tasks.summary: Implement a merge queue buffer + release stub tied to guard suites.
tasks.description: Add a buffer in exporter.rs/runner.rs that holds casts until cargo fmt/clippy/test pass plus human approval, logging CI outputs inside ChangeQueueLog for auditability.

phases.name: Phase 3 — RATATUI Visibility & Observability
phases.summary: Surface queue/guard telemetry inside the TUI and emit structured reports for dashboards.

tasks.summary: Surface queue metrics + guard history in the RATATUI panels.
tasks.description: Update tui.rs/fs_watch.rs to display queue depth, cast latency, WAL progress, guard command results, approvals, and ChangeQueueLog insights.
verification: echo 'TUI snapshot references cast latency, queue depth, guard outcomes'

tasks.summary: Emit structured telemetry per run for dashboards to trend.
tasks.description: Write queue depth, WAL checkpoint stats, dedup hits, and guard results into execution/verification_report.json on every run so dashboards ingest deterministic telemetry.

phases.name: Phase 4 — Testing, Governance & Playbooks
phases.summary: Create cast replay fixtures, capture WAL audits, and document governance playbooks for operators.

tasks.summary: Expand CI/tests with cast replay fixtures and WAL audits.
tasks.description: Export sample payloads from request/models, build fixtures that replay casts, and verify WAL retention plus guard logging during cargo test runs.

tasks.summary: Update docs/playbooks to explain the deterministic cast lifecycle.
tasks.description: Refresh README.md, HYPERION.md, references/ASI_FRAMEWORK.md, and references/QUESTIONS.md with the issue bridge story, guard requirements, telemetry expectations, and lingering decisions.

phases.name: Phase 5 — AI Agent Integration
phases.summary: Introduce an AI agent harness that produces TaskRequest/ChangeRequest payloads and ensures every cast is approved before enqueue.

tasks.summary: Define agent harness responsibilities and validation hooks.
tasks.description: Clarify how the AI agent should gather intent, generate TaskRequest payloads, validate against the schemas, and capture approval metadata before hitting the orchestrator.

tasks.summary: Wire the agent into the orchestrator/request path.
tasks.description: Update orchestrator.rs/request.rs to accept AI-produced TaskRequest JSON, translate it into ChangeRequests, and submit them via cargo run -- enqueue while recording guard outputs.

phases.name: Phase 6 — Agent Monitoring & Feedback
phases.summary: Track agent outcomes, approvals, and telemetry so operators trust the automation.

tasks.summary: Emit telemetry that correlates agent requests with guard runs.
tasks.description: Push agent-generated metrics (requests/sec, approval latency, guard success rate) into execution/verification_report.json and mirror them in the TUI metrics panel.

tasks.summary: Document the agent workflow plus outstanding decisions.
tasks.description: Refresh README.md, HYPERION.md, references/ASI_FRAMEWORK.md, and references/QUESTIONS.md with the agent automation story, guard requirements, and any unresolved governance questions.

phases.name: Phase 7 — Cast Builder & Agent Export
phases.summary: Add a human-in-the-loop REPL that finalizes casts before Copilot ingestion and ensure exported skills reflect the structured guidance flow.

tasks.summary: Design the cast-builder REPL/subcommand that negotiates intent + approvals and writes cast JSON for Copilot agents.
tasks.description: Implement a `hyperion cast` (or exported-skill) REPL that records the conversation, collects AssignmentMetadata (intent, complexity, sample diff, telemetry anchors, approvals), and writes the approved phase/task JSON into `taskjson/` so Copilot agents ingest a deterministic payload.

tasks.summary: Ship an exportable skill that orchestrates the REPL and cast submission into Copilot agents.
tasks.description: Create a `skills/cast-builder` (or similar) directory with a SKILL manifest that mimics the workplan skill scaffolding so agentic operators know which scripts to run, how progress is tracked, and how to export the cast JSON into the queue.

phases.name: Phase 8 — TUI Visibility for Cast Builder
phases.summary: Show the new cast-builder lifecycle and export skill state inside the TUI so operators know when casts are finalized and exported.

tasks.summary: Add a TUI panel that highlights the cast-builder export status and next-task context.
tasks.description: Extend `src/tui.rs` to render the latest cast-builder assignment intent/complexity plus the export skill status using the `execution/next_task_context.json` data, ensuring operators can see when a cast is ready for Copilot agents.
verification: Run `cargo run -- queue-metrics --format json` and confirm the new cast-builder fields appear
TUI screenshot or log entry referencing cast-builder status

tasks.summary: Document the TUI changes plus how the exported skill surfaces status in the dashboard.
tasks.description: Update README.md and HYPERION.md (or a dedicated docs file) so you know which TUI panes show cast-builder telemetry, what the statuses mean, and how to correlate them with the exported skill/plan tracker.

phases.name: Phase 9 — Cast Skill Distribution
phases.summary: Package the cast-builder experience as a reusable skill and exporting bundle so other operator agents can reuse the workflow.

tasks.summary: Document and test the `skills/cast-builder` manifest plus the cast-builder helper.
tasks.description: Ensure `skills/cast-builder/SKILL.md` references `scripts/cast_builder.sh` and explains how to run the REPL so imported skills follow the same approvals + metadata flow.

tasks.summary: Build an export bundle for the cast-builder skill and documentation.
tasks.description: Create a tarball or archive containing the skill manifest, helper script, and docs so downstream repos can adopt the workflow without guessing which files to copy.

phases.name: Phase 10 — Guarded Delivery & Governance
phases.summary: Extend the governance story so the new cast-builder workflow, telemetry, and TUI visibility are audit-ready.

tasks.summary: Clarify the telemetry contract between the verification report and the new cast builder context.
tasks.description: Describe what metrics the Cast Builder panel, `execution/verification_report.json`, and `execution/next_task_context.json` expose so reviewers know how guard runs tie back to exported casts.

tasks.summary: Document the cast-builder + TUI story inside the governance references.
tasks.description: Update `references/ASI_FRAMEWORK.md`, `references/QUESTIONS.md`, and `HYPERION.md` to include links to the new panels, scripts, and outstanding decisions so future reviewers see how the automation is audited.
